page.title: 09Recreation in the area.
page.content: The Country Park at Talkin Tarn is the scene of many recreational activities. On a busy day, over a thousand visitors may be seen. They picnic, paddle, hire rowing boats, fish and patronise the shop. Swimming is discouraged because the water is very cold away from the edge. There are camping facilities, nature trails and guided walks. School groups use the area for sailing, study and learning activities. Annually there are sailing and rowing regattas. In snowy weather, the hill slopes are ideal for tobogganing. Even in cold, stormy weather there is usually somebody to be seen walking a dog on the footpath round the Tarn. With so much water activity, a rescue craft which can reach anyone in difficulty is essential, and is used frequently.
